column4: Hi, im having an Intel HD audio card, why does applications steal the audio input/output's? I need to kill the running application who uses the sound before I can use it in another application. If im going to watch a video on youtube, I have to kill amarok first and restart all applications. Its QUITE annoying..
I've searched and readed that maybe alsa had some fix for this? like running an alsa daemon to solve multiple sound output?
click preferences in the gnome meny
sound capture is set to   ALSA.  ESD sound mixing is ticked.  default mixer is HDA Intel which probably got bad drivers after what I read on the internet
try setting play back to ESD first
now im playing music in amarok, and the test button is working. let me try if it works with firefox..but I havent changed anything..
no sound output from firefox when amarok or something else got the soundinput.
I think perhaps the flash plugin for firefox has its own set of sound sharing issues
you say something there. let me apt-get xmms too.
sorry for slow response, trying to figure out how xmms2 works.. heh..
Steve-cal sounds like he knows more than me anyway

now it works. I edited amarok to specify alsa as output and not autodetect. so now both amarok and audacious is playing music. trying with firefox now :)
im stuck with firefox, since flash plugin is not able to configure output device :(
did you set also as output for all type of playback in the configurator thing?
